conclusion: Analyze forces acting on each object and determine new equilibrium state when mass of object C is changed to 5m.
Object A (mass 2m) is connected to object B (mass 3m) via a spring. Object C (mass m) is connected to object A via a rope over a pulley. The system is initially in equilibrium.
For object A in initial equilibrium: 2mg = kx1 + T1.
For object C in initial equilibrium: mg = T1.
Object C now has a mass of 5m. The system reaches a new equilibrium.
For object A in new equilibrium: 2mg = kx2 + T2.
For object C in new equilibrium: 5mg = T2.
Determine the new tension T2: T2 = 5mg.
Determine the new compression x2: kx2 = -3mg, thus x2 = 3mg/k.
Determine the initial compression x1: kx1 = mg, thus x1 = mg/k.
Calculate the change in height of object A: Δx = x1 - x2 = -2mg/k.
Since Δx is negative, object A rises by 2mg/k.
The height that object A rises during this process is 2mg/k.
